raw_text:
Henry tipped for Fifa award
 
 Fifa president Sepp Blatter hopes Arsenal's Thierry Henry will be named World Player of the Year on Monday.
 
 Henry is on the Fifa shortlist with Barcelona's Ronaldinho and newly-crowned European Footballer of the Year, AC Milan's Andriy Shevchenko. Blatter said: "Henry, for me, is the personality on the field. He is the man who can run and organise the game." The winner of the accolade will be named at a glittering ceremony at Zurich's Opera house. The three shortlisted candidates for the women's award are Mia Hamm of the United States, Germany's Birgit Prinz and Brazilian youngster Marta.
 
 Hamm, who recently retired - is looking to regain the women's award, which she lost last year to striker Prinz. Fifa has changed the panel of voters for this year's awards. Male and female captains of every national team will be able to vote, as well as their coaches and Fipro - the global organisation for professional players.
llama3.2:1b: Henry tipped for FIFA award; Blatter hopes Henry will win World Player of the Year.
Henry is on Fifa shortlist with Ronaldinho and Shevchenko.
Award winner will be named at Zurich's Opera house ceremony.
Hamm, Prinz, and Marta are also shortlisted for women's award.
llama3.2:3b: Thierry Henry is in the running for FIFA World Player of the Year with Ronaldinho and Andriy Shevchenko, according to Sepp Blatter; Mia Hamm, Birgit Prinz, and Marta are among those on the women's shortlist.
gemma2:2b: Thierry Henry is a nominee for FIFA World Player of the Year alongside Ronaldinho and Andriy Shevchenko.
The winner will be announced at an event in Zurich on Monday.
Mia Hamm, who won the award last year, is looking to regain her title this year.
Male and female captains, coaches, and Fipro (global organization for professional players) will be eligible to vote.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Fifa president Sepp Blatter is expecting Arsenal goalkeeper Thierry Henry to win the World Player of the Year award at Zurich's Opera house in October.
The winner will be named in a glittering ceremony.
Three male and female captains from every national team will be able to vote for their own players.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Fifa president Sepp Blatter believes Arsenal player Thierry Henry should win World Player of the Year award, making him one of three shortlisted candidates alongside Ronaldinho from Barcelona and Andriy Shevchenko from AC Milan.
The winner will be announced at a ceremony in Zurich's Opera house on Monday.
For women's awards, Hamm is targeting a victory after losing last year to Prinz, while coaches and Fipro members can also vote.
qwen2.5:3b: Fifa president Sepp Blatter expects Arsenal's Thierry Henry to win the World Player of the Year award, citing his leadership on the field.
Henry is nominated alongside Ronaldinho from Barcelona and Andriy Shevchenko from AC Milan.
The ceremony will be held at Zurich's Opera House with Hamm, Prinz, and Marta vying for the Women's award.
This year’s voting panel includes national team captains, coaches, and Fipro.
opencoder:1.5b: "FIFA president Sepp Blatter predicts that Arsenal's Thierry Henry will receive the World Player of the Year on Monday.
He is also eligible to win the European Footballer of the Year, which he recently won with AC Milan's Andriy Shevchenko.
The footballer for this season has gained recognition at a ceremony on Sunday at the Opera house of Zurich.
The three players listed as having been shortlisted for the women's award are Henry, Hamm and his Brazilian youngster Marta."
smollm:1.7b: Henry is on the shortlist with Barcelona's Ronaldinho and newly-crowned European Footballer of the Year, AC Milan's Andriy Shevchenko.
The winner of the award will be named at a glittering ceremony at Zurich's Opera house.
The three shortlisted candidates for the women's award are Mia Hamm of the United States, Germany's Birgit Prinz and Brazilian youngster Marta.

Henry is praised by Fifa president Sepp Blatter for his personality—ability to run and organize the game—as he would be considered a man who can perform well on the field.
The winner will be awarded at a glittering ceremony in Zurich.
For the women's award, the panel includes Mia Hamm of the United States, Germany's Birgit Prinz, and Brazilian youngster Marta.
Fifa has expanded voting eligibility to include male/female team captains, their coaches, and Fipro players.

He believes that Henry's personalities on the field, along with being a versatile attacker who can run and organize games, make him the clear winner.
The three shortlisted candidates for the women's award are Miya Hamm of the United States, Marta of Brazil, and Birgit Prinz of Germany.
Fifa has changed the voting panel to include both male and female captain of every national team, as well as coaches and players' federation leaders.

Hamm is looking to regain the Women's Player of the Year title she lost last year.
Female team captains, coaches, and Fipro will also be voting for this year's awards.

granite3.1-dense:2b: Fifa president Sepp Blatter expects Arsenal's Thierry Henry to win the World Player of the Year award on Monday at Zurich's Opera house, alongside Barcelona's Ronaldinho and AC Milan's Andriy Shevchenko.
